bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, March 3, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests that Rodriguez-Leon review his report to Ramos, concerning the true location of Camp Lazear, before he arrives in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, March 3, 1941
div1.opener:
Copy to Moran
3/6/41 - Sent comic
etc
March 3, 1941
My dear Senora Rodriguez-Leon:
div1.p:
I have sent to Mr. Moran a preliminary copy of my report
on the true location of Camp Lazear which I am to send to Dr. Domingo
Ramos. Unfortunately, I could only send two copies and I am asking
him to review his copy and pass one on to you at his earliest possible
convenience. I do hope you can review it and let me have your comments
and corrections either directly or through Mr. Moran. The great diffi-
culty is that I am trying to make my final copy within the next ten
days and mail the final report to Dr. Ramos about March 15 so that he
(or his deputy) may be able to read it before I come to Havana April 4 Mar 27
or 5 for about one week.

May I ask you therefore to do me the great favor of looking
over my report as soon as you possibly can? You have been so helpful to
me and I can't tell you how much I appreciate it. I hope I can pay you
my respects in a short time.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
